main event: A point of light, resembling the size of a head of a pin, was sighted in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, on July 2, 1958.
interesting points: The object was yellow-white in color and disappeared with flashing lights,The object was visible for 6-8 seconds,The sighting was classified using various potential explanations including meteor, balloon, aircraft, and astronomical events,The witness was identified as a civilian employed as a sales engineer,The sighting occurred under clear, hazy conditions with no visible clouds.
witness description: civilian, employed by Arco Corporation, Philadelphia, Sales Engineer
